page.title: 13HOME LIFE IN LUGWARDINE
page.content: Out of a population of approx. 500, 30 regularly attend the Parish Church of St Peter's in Lugwardine, yet 80% receive the Parish Magazine. Records are continuous from 1546. Burials are still traditional here - only 30% are cremated. Few families have young children. Out of 79 children at the village school, only 17 live in the area studied. The remainder come from the 150 houses on the estate at Wilcroft. The present school, built in 1840, is inadequate and a new village school is likely to be built on the Wilcroft Estate in the near future. Children eat packed lunches at school, so families eat together in the evening. Shopping is done at a nearby supermarket or in the City. Much fresh fruit and veg. is grown locally. It is normal for families to have two cars. Most use microwave ovens, videos etc.
